topic.title: MuWire - Easy Anonymous File-Sharing
topic.body:
https://github.com/zlatinb/muwire

"MuWire - Easy Anonymous File-Sharing
MuWire is an easy to use file-sharing program which offers anonymity using I2P technology.

It is inspired by the LimeWire Gnutella client and developped by a former LimeWire developer.

The project is in development. You can find technical documentation in the "doc" folder."

1552755084_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
I use a DiskStation DS918+ and shit works fantastic.
Biggest downside is getting the NAS to mount on ubuntu. But other than that works great for very large  file storage

1553845855_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
use qBittorrent for private tracker then BiglyBT for public and i2p torrents similar to Vuze but actively developed. 
with the i2p plugin you can either connect via the client itself or your i2p client you already have running. 
works well with i2pd too https://i2pd.website/

Website: https://www.biglybt.com/
Github: https://github.com/BiglySoftware/BiglyBT

1559842566_1Ar9D7DWtCHBepnH4fpDsxpW95evS.body: Been testing it with i2pd and has been working swell

> [robione](#comment_13_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): contribute an installer?

If you are on windows you can take a look here: https://github.com/zlatinb/muwire/issues/3
Also regular i2p and i2pd have windows installers to use if you havnt already.
https://geti2p.net/en/ = easiest to config
https://i2pd.website/ = harder to config

> [robione](#comment_13_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): contribute an installer?

Now there is one that can be found here with the latest version. 
https://muwire.com/
